meanings.definition: The act or process of accumulating.
meanings.sent1: Her accumulations of toys filled the entire room.
meanings.sent2: The accumulations of leaves in the yard needed to be raked.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's accumulations of nuts were so large, they spilled out of the tree.
meanings.sent4: His accumulations of knowledge made him the smartest person in the class.
meanings.sent5: The accumulations of snow on the mountain were breathtaking.

meanings.definition: An amount of something that has been collected or gathered over time.
meanings.sent1: The accumulations of coins in the jar were saved for a special occasion.
meanings.sent2: Over the years, her accumulations of books turned into a personal library.
meanings.sent3: The child's accumulations of seashells from the beach were displayed proudly in a jar.
meanings.sent4: The accumulations of dust on the old furniture made it look abandoned.
meanings.sent5: The accumulations of stars in the night sky were mesmerizing.
